bug.author: SalChem
bug.summary: Unable to create widget for path dialogue box
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
Using Ttinker package to get a path dialogue box to input as the file name, but it does not seem to support. Plz advice if there is a workaroud this. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
import streamlit as st import tkinter as tk from tkinter import filedialog root = tk.Tk() root.withdraw() file_path = filedialog.askopenfilename() fname = st.text_input(file_path) if fname != "": st.write("Reading text file...", fname) # code for file manipulation

comments.comment:
That's an interesting idea, mixing traditional GUI components with Streamlit apps. I hadn't considered that! In your case, I can get rid of the error by assigning the root window in askopenfilename(): file_path = filedialog.askopenfilename(master=root) I don't fully understand Tkinter, though, so this was just a happy guess! <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
Of course, the more Streamlit-y solution would be this one: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/120>#120</denchmark-link>
Please vote on it if it's something you'd like to see implemented!
